metadata.title: CVE-2022-24883 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).Prior to version 2.7.0, server side authentication against a `SAM` filemight be successful for invalid credentials if the server has configured aninvalid `SAM` file path. FreeRDP based clients are not affected. RDP serverimplementations using FreeRDP to authenticate against a `SAM` file areaffected. Version 2.7.0 contains a fix for this issue. As a workaround, usecustom authentication via `HashCallback` and/or ensure the `SAM` databasepath configured is valid and the application has file handles left.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libuwac0-0 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
winpr-utils - 2.7.0+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.0+dfsg1-1').
